intro: Senniella spongiosa var. xylocarpa, commonly known as the spongy senniella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its unique, spongy, and often hollow stems, which are adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. This variant is native to parts of southern Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
